job_description:
Company Description
At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.
You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.
We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.
We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.
When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

Job Description
Are you looking for freedom to grow and develop in an organization that highly values sense of ownership?
Our successful Environmental Services team in the Benelux is currently hiring a Senior Environmental Consultant Soil & Groundwater Remediation to be based in our The Hague office. Within this role you work in a dynamic group which undertakes a wide variety of projects for mainly international private sector clients based in the Netherlands and abroad. These projects involve (but are not limited to) contaminated soil investigation, remediation, risk assessment, remedial design and follow-up.
As a Senior Environmental Consultant you have a challenging and diversified scope of responsibilities, ensuring the good completion of smaller to large size and complex soil and groundwater projects, as well as supporting other environmental businesses.
Key duties and responsibilities:
Performing the environmental oversight of remedial works on the site for short or longer periods of time under the supervision of a project manager.
Controlling the performance of the remediation contractor works with respect to the remedial action plan.
Coordinating field service subcontractors and fully supervise ground investigation works if required.
Collecting soil and groundwater samples / data during assessment and remedial action activities.
Daily reporting and regulator reporting (Flanders region) of works conducted on site.
Coordinating with laboratories to secure appropriate analysis and in a timetable consistent with project requirements.
Compiling and interpret field and analytical data into accurate and comprehensive conceptual site models
Undertaking desk studies, site investigations, laboratory procurement for environmental analysis, data analysis, factual and interpretive report writing.
Ensuring that health and safety issues are addressed throughout the life of a project. AECOM has a strong safety culture which is supported across the business worldwide.
As part of our team, you're expected to implement safety, quality and customer focus into your day-to-day activities. You’ll participate in all safety initiatives, you’ll ensure the safety of yourself and your colleagues and you’ll support and achieve safety objectives through orienting, training and coaching.

Qualifications

Our ideal candidate has a Master or BSc degree in Geology, Geography, Bio Engineering or another technical, environmental or chemical field of study.
We are looking for a Dutch speaking colleague with fluent English written and verbal language skills. Good French skills is seen as a plus.
Between 7-10 years of experience in a comparable role within the environmental consultancy sector, with a strong portfolio of similar soil and groundwater phase II and remediation projects.
Confidence and at ease with client communication, relationship building and stakeholder management.
You are a decision taker with a good sense of responsibility and ownership.
Excellent analytical, report writing and communication skills.
Solid attention to detail and thorough approach to work.
Good knowledge of Dutch Soil & Groundwater legislation (both past and present)
Able to work both independently and in teams.
You are an innovative thinker who enjoys self-development and taking initiative while working in a young and dynamic team.
Willingness to travel occasionally within mainly the Netherlands and occasionally Belgium or abroad to meet the needs of specific projects.
Valid driver license for a car.
Additional Information
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.
Join us and let’s get started.
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.
Join us and let’s get started.

Job Description
Scope of Activities

Fluor Consultants BV is focusing on developing long term relationships with customers in revamping, debottlenecking and expanding the production capacity of their existing facilities in the process Industry in the South West of the Netherlands. The Bergen op Zoom and Rotterdam offices provide the full project execution services: from conceptual engineering through commissioning and construction support. Together with Stork (a Fluor company) we have the unique market capacity to offer integrated solutions to our clients. This includes fabrication, modularization and maintenance.

The process group is a dynamic team in which technology, process design and leadership skills are combined to effectively support our clients. In addition to a solid education focusing on process design and/or process control, a strong set of personal competencies is a prerequisite for a successful process engineer. Being a team player and having an ability to interact effectively with client’s organization and others disciplines in our taskforce is essential.

Process engineers take overall responsibility for the process and process control functionality for projects in the oil, gas and (petro-) chemical industry, renewable energy solutions, life science and advanced manufacturing. They work within a task force for the realization of multi-discipline projects in close cooperation with vendors and clients to translate functional specifications into technical solutions

Key Responsibilities
The successful candidate is responsible for and must be able / willing to develop knowledge to:
1. Perform engineering under guidance of a senior in all project phases e.g. Feasibility studies, conceptual design, front-end design, detail engineering and design and plant commissioning for integration of new facilities in revamp type project as well for ‘small’ grass-root type of projects. Work activities include e.g.:
Develop the process configuration that best supports the client’s business case during the conceptual engineeringFurther development of the process design and ensure that the required functionality is maintained during the following design and engineering phases.Towards project completion, the process engineers are involved in testing and start-up of the facility; either in a leading role or supporting the client.
More senior engineers actively support the business development process by supporting our clients with their definition of new projects and by preparing competitive proposals.
2. Supervision, planning, organization of the work:
Coordinate the process engineering activities, assign work in cooperation with senior lead engineerPrepare schedules, estimates, manpower forecasts and apply change-risk management.Communicate and align with clients, vendors and other disciplines.
Supervise and act as mentor for a group of junior and intermediate level engineers
3. Promoting and support Value improvements initiatives and Continuous Performance Improvement

Proven Experience
5 - 15 years relevant working experience with an engineering contractor or production company in the process industry.
Knowledge of process design and -engineeringField process engineering knowledge is a preferenceExhibit thorough understanding of pertinent codes and governing regulations and industry practicesExhibit thorough understanding of the other discipline task and deliverables like mechanical, piping and instrumentation.
To be Considered Candidates:
Must be authorized to work in the country where the position is located.
Basic Job Requirements
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor, Master degree or equivalent in chemical engineeringCandidates shall be fluent in both Dutch and English;
Written and verbal communication with our Client’s is as well in Dutch as in English

Strong interpersonal skillsWillingness to travelBe able to multi-task
Requisition Number
134592BR
Diverse Workforce
We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value of a diverse workforce. All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by governing law.

21942BR
Requisition Number:
21942BR
Description:
Stantec is tientallen jaren actief in de Nederlandse ingenieursmarkt. We zijn succesvol in het winnen en uitvoeren van openbare aanbestedingen, zoals voor de grootste Nederlandse gemeenten, netbeheerders (elektriciteit, drinkwater, data) en Rijkswaterstaat. Via een combinatie van tariefstelling en uitmuntende kwaliteit kiezen opdrachtgevers voor onze aanpak. Wil jij als EMVI schrijver het verschil maken bij al onze aanbestedingen in Nederland? Solliciteer dan nu op de vacature EMVI schrijver bij Stantec.
Stantec Nederland maakt de wereld beter door vanuit concrete vraagstukken te komen tot praktische oplossingen. We werken binnen de maatschappelijke thema’s duurzaamheid, leefbaarheid en veiligheid in de domeinen ruimtelijke kwaliteit, transities (energie, klimaat, materialen) en betere naleving.
Wij maken echt het verschil door onze innovatiekracht en vermogen om veranderingen tot stand te brengen. Daarbij gebruiken wij op een slimme manier bestaande data bij het vinden van duurzame en gedragen oplossingen.
Naast 1 op 1 relaties met klanten winnen wij een aanzienlijk deel van ons werk wij via openbare aanbestedingen. Ondanks dat aanbestedingen een vast format hebben en voorgeschreven werkwijzen halen wij onze doelen ook in die contracten. Zo gaan wij altijd het gesprek aan over strategische samenwerking, ook al zijn de gecontracteerde werkzaamheden uitvoerend van aard. Wij kijken graag vooruit en anticiperen met de opdrachtgever op (toekomstige) ontwikkelingen zoals de energietransitie en de omgevingswet.
Wat zijn je belangrijkste taken en verantwoordelijkheden?
Je verwoordt op een unieke manier hoe wij meerwaarde leveren aan de opdrachtgever.
Je haalt acties input op bij onze vakspecialisten en vertaalt dat naar een winnend kwaliteitsplan.
Je maakt vast onderdeel uit van ons team contractmanagement en aanbestedingen en werkt in steeds wisselende bidteams.
Als er tijdelijk weinig openbare aanbestedingen lopen draag je bijvoorbeeld bij aan het creëren van content voor op onze website of op social media (LinkedIN)
Je hebt voldoende doorgroeimogelijkheden, bijvoorbeeld naar een zwaardere rol in tenderteams of ons communicatieteam.
Dit krijg je van ons:
Jouw doordachte oplossingen verdienen een mooie beloning. Die krijg je in de vorm van goede voorwaarden en een werkomgeving die minstens zo innovatief is als je ideeën. Je welzijn is daarbij onze prioriteit. Dit krijg je van ons:
Een passend salaris en goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een eindejaarsuitkering, NS Businesscard en 28 vakantiedagen.
Een afwisselende baan van 32, 36 of 40 uur per week, waarbij je echt impact kunt maken op de leefomgeving.
Een klimaatneutrale werkomgeving waar duurzaamheid voorop staat. Dat zie je o.a. terug in een elektrisch wagenpark, vegetarische catering en gave samenwerkingen met goede doelen.
Een divers team en een inclusieve cultuur. We voeren een actief diversiteitsbeleid om bij te dragen aan gelijke kansen. Talent en competenties vormen het uitgangspunt.
Veel ruimte voor jouw eigen ideeën en initiatieven. Kom maar door!
Je mag werken waar en op het tijdstip dat jij het beste uit jezelf kan halen, de ene dag in een bruisende kantoortuin waar collega’s uit alle lagen van de organisatie naast elkaar werken en de andere dag werk je vanuit huis en ga je lekker ’s middags sporten.*
Een thuiswerkregeling, we verzorgen een goede werkplek bij je thuis en je ontvangt maandelijks een netto internetvergoeding á € 36,10 per maand.
Oneindig veel gezamenlijke activiteiten en leuke trainingen waardoor werk niet meer als werk voelt.
Title:
EMVI schrijver
Qualifications:
Wat neem je mee?
je blinkt uit in schrijfvaardigheid en krijgt energie van het schrijven van scherpe en aantrekkelijke
communicaties;
een afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding zoals communicatie of een technische studie;
minimaal 3 jaar relevante ervaring met het schrijven van aantrekkelijke communicaties, in welke vorm dan
ook;
je hebt kennis van EMVI-plannen en aanbestedingen;
je draait je hand niet om voor het bepalen en verwoorden van de kernboodschap. Voor welk publiek dan
ook.
Employment Type: Full-Time
Job Type: Regular
Job Category: Technical Advisor, Technical Writing
About Stantec:
Als Stantec maken we de wereld beter. Dat doen we samen met 26.000 collega’s, werkend op 400 locaties, verdeeld over 6 continenten. Dit zijn stuk voor stuk mensgerichte adviseurs die geloven in een leefbare, veilige en duurzame omgeving. Met samenwerkingen, onderbouwd advies en een gezonde dosis lef maken we het verschil. In Nederland doen we dat met 300 betrokken professionals onder het motto ‘design with community in mind’.
Bij Stantec werken we vanuit concrete vraagstukken naar praktische oplossingen. Hierbij gaan we altijd de dialoog aan met de betrokkenen, maken we slim gebruik van bestaande data en durven we keuzes te maken. Ook als die verrassend zijn. Resultaat zijn innovatieve, gedragen oplossingen waarmee we de wereld een stukje beter maken. Samen met jou.
Meer weten over de werksfeer binnen onze organisatie? We vertellen je hier graag alles over Stantec als werkgever: https://www.stantec.com/nl/careers
Additional Information:
Meer informatie over Stantec als werkgever vind je hier: https://www.stantec.com/nl/careers
Ben jij klaar om onze opdrachtgevers te helpen met je out-of-the-box-mindset? We leren je graag kennen! Solliciteer meteen via de knop hieronder. Meer weten over de functie EMVI-schrijver? Bel dan met Wouter Hoogenraad, Business Line Manager via 06-22199454.
Een assessment kan onderdeel uitmaken van de procedure.
Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.
Location :
Netherlands
Country:
Netherlands
State/Province:
Flexible
City:
Arnhem, Delft, Eindhoven, Oosterhout

Arup is the creative force at the heart of many of the world’s most prominent projects in the built environment, transport and energy sectors. Independently owned and independently minded, we offer a broad range of professional services that combine to make a real difference to our clients and the communities in which we work. For more than 75 years, we have helped bring to life ground-breaking projects across the globe. We are truly global, and our 17,000 planners, designers, engineers and consultants around the world deliver innovative projects with creativity and passion.

We are a global market leader in infrastructure and energy technical and ESG advisory for investors, evidenced by the many awards we have won in this space. Infrastructure Journal, the leading infrastructure investment outlet, has awarded Arup the Global Technical Advisor award four years in a row now, plus we have been awarded the Infrastructure Journal Global ESG Advisor award the last two years running.

Junior Consultant Investment Advisory

Our global award winning and market leading business and investor advisory (BIA) team provides technical, commercial and sustainable advisory for investors and project developers in the energy transition. We do so at strategic level – where and in what to invest –, in live transactions – sell-side and buy-side due diligence, and at portfolio level – how can investors convert existing portfolios towards the needs of the energy transition.

Currently we are rapidly growing our recently established BIA team in Amsterdam that focusses on the EU and predominantly Benelux and wider northwestern Europe.
You will work closely with BIA team members as well as technical specialists across Arup globally. Given the nature of the job, you will interact directly with senior management from the businesses and get exposure as to how these businesses are operated whilst also gaining an understanding of what the key drivers are. Our projects generally last between 4-10 weeks meaning in a year you can work on up to 8-10 different projects across a variety of assets and geographies, giving you exposure to several different assets and clients. Our projects are fast-paced and provide you with opportunities to develop quickly whilst gaining a range of experience.

Your background
You should have a technical understanding and interest in any or, preferably more, of the following energy transition assets:
Renewable energy (e.g., solar, wind)Hydrogen value chainBattery manufacturing and/or storageBiogas, biomethaneLow emission mobility like EV charging, biofuels, sustainable aviation fuels, sustainable maritime fuels
You will also be able to demonstrate some initial commercial and/or regulatory understanding in these sectors in the Netherlands and preferably wider EU.

Your responsibilities

Provide comfort on technical, commercial and Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) aspects for infrastructure and energy investors through the production of due diligence reports, business plans, strategic insights and portfolio optimisation studies
Perform a key analyst role in international and multi-disciplinary project delivery teams, liaising with other experts within and outside the organisation on complex issues
Distilling large amounts of information towards key technical and ESG business plan drivers, inter alia through working with data analytics tools
Collaborate with wider international teams to develop our sustainable investment offering
Attend meetings with clients to present findings on projects
Likely to involve short business travel (mainly Europe)

Your profile
You can identify yourself with our values and you want to collaborate with us in shaping a better world with iconic and innovative projects. To maintain Arup’s high-quality standards, we would expect you to meet the following minimum criteria:

A Bachelor/ Master degree in commercial, economic, or financial analysis, and/or relevant working experience in a related role
Core skills in commercial and market analysis, problem solving, and an ability to adapt and apply these to a range of projects.
Excellent communication skills (written and spoken Dutch & English at least B2 level) and ability to distil complex analysis into key messages and develop these into a coherent narrative. You will also have responsibility to present findings and discuss these with clients.
Adaptability and flexibility to work on projects with relatively short deadlines, with changing scope and focus as information and analysis evolves.
Strong knowledge of both Excel and PowerPoint as tools to undertake and present analysis.
Desire and capability to engage in business development and client relationship building.
Keenness for emerging, sustainable infrastructure and industrial sectors
Affinity translating technical solutions into bankable and sustainable projects
Highly motivated, proactive and willing to take on new challenges

About working at Arup
At Arup, you will work alongside some of the most talented people, who share your ambition to make a difference while being part of an employee-owned company putting sustainable development at the heart of our work and strategy. You’ll get to work on projects that push people’s expectations of what’s possible, from inspiring buildings to projects that will shape our future and help us mitigate the impact of climate change. We offer you a job in a multicultural and informal international working environment with excellent colleagues. Arup is a place where creativity, innovation and exciting technical challenges are always possible; we are part of a team that enjoys what they do, embracing a unique culture. As a global firm we can develop careers in the Netherlands or abroad through international assignments, and our commitment to training and development is fundamental to ensure we continue to develop our staff and look to the future requirements of our clients.

We offer you an Arup contract with a competitive salary and good fringe benefits such as an excellent pension and travel expenses, OV chipcard 1st class, even travelling by bike is covered.
At Arup, you work in an international environment that enables you to share knowledge and experience with the whole world. In addition, there are short- and long-term opportunities to work in one of our offices abroad
Arup is an independent, employee-owned company. Employees at Arup are shareholders of the organisation and are eligible for the Global Profit Share programme. This means that as an employee you will receive a profit share twice a year.
A relatively large part of our capital is reinvested in training and research. These budgets are available to all employees.
We have our own Arup University with internal and external training courses to keep you constantly developing.
Arup arranges all facilities so you can work ergonomically and responsibly from home.

Find out more
For more information about the hiring process, contact Evelien Wind, recruitment business partner at Arup in The Netherlands, by e-mail: recruitmentnl@arup.com. Or contact Maarten Wessels, Associate by e-mail: Maarten.Wessels@arup.com for more substantive information on this role.

How to apply
Got excited and want to apply? Please use the ‘apply’ button to upload your cv and letter of motivation (English only) into the Arup application portal on our website www.arup.com/careers.

The application process will focus predominantly on good conversations about our sectors, experiences, insights, ambitions and ideas. On how you can help drive infrastructure to become more resilient and sustainable, but also how Arup can help you progress you career.

Job Description
Scope of Activities

Fluor Consultants BV is focusing on developing long-term relationships with customers in revamping, debottlenecking and expanding the production capacity of their existing facilities in the process Industry in the south west Netherlands. The Bergen op Zoom and Rotterdam offices provide the full project execution services; from conceptual engineering through commissioning and construction support. Together with Stork (a Fluor company), we have a unique market capacity to offer integrated solutions to our clients. This includes fabrication, modularization and maintenance.

The Electrical & Instrumentation & Control System (EI&CS) group is a dynamic team in which engineering, design and leadership skills are combined to effectively support our clients. In addition to a solid education focusing on engineering and design, a strong set of personal competencies is a prerequisite for success. Being a team player and having an ability to interact effectively with client’s organization and others disciplines in our taskforce is essential.

In our projects, engineers/designers take responsibility for the functionality of the EI&CS project scope in the oil, gas and (petro)-chemical industry, renewable energy solutions, life sciences and advanced manufacturing. They work within a task force for the realization of multi-discipline projects in close cooperation with vendors and clients to translate functional specifications into technical solutions.

Key Responsibilities
The successful candidate is responsible for and must be able to:
Perform engineering under guidance of a senior in all project phases e.g. Feasibility studies, conceptual design, front-end design, detail engineering and design and plant commissioning for integration of new facilities in revamp type project as well for ‘small’ grass-root type of projects for installations in all voltage levels HV, MV, LV. Work activities can include:Development (and willing to learn): the engineering and design details to properly size, calculate, design and description of the installation details for a complete and operating electrical system that meets the Client requirements for E.g.: Feeder panels, MCC’s, Substations, Transformers, Motors, Power Cables, Lightning systems, Grounding systems; a contractors scope of work and oversee the development of detailed design drawings like one line diagrams, plans, wiring details and fabrication drawings;
Supporting the complete cycle of writing/reviewing electrical specifications in accordance with client requirements and authority regulations, supplier selection, purchasing, supplier drawing review, Factory Acceptance Tests, coordinate field implementation including Site Acceptance Test, commissioning and turn-over. This for all system hardware required.
To be Considered Candidates:
Must be authorized to work in the country where the position is located.
Basic Job Requirements
Proven Experience
Minimum 2 to 5 years relevant working experience with an engineering contractor or production company in the process industry.Understanding of electrical engineering / power systems for both high and low voltage
Knowledge of electrical network programs like VISION, ETAP is preferredWilling to build field experiences for all electrical equipmentWilling to learn pertinent codes and governing regulations and industry practicesWilling to learn the interfaces with other discipline task and deliverables like instrumentation, control system, process and mechanical
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor, Master degree or equivalent in electrical power systems / high voltage engineeringCandidates shall be fluent in both Dutch and English.Written and verbal communication with our clients is in Dutch and in English
Strong interpersonal skillsWilling to travelBe able to multi-task between multiple projects
Requisition Number
134565BR
Diverse Workforce
We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value of a diverse workforce. All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by governing law.

21884BR
Requisition Number:
21884BR
Description:
We staan in Nederland de komende jaren voor grote ruimtelijke opgaven. De implementatie van de Omgevingswet, de energietransitie en het oplopende woning tekort. Onze adviseurs spelen in op deze maatschappelijke vraagstukken. Met een integrale aanpak, in samenwerking met alle stakeholders in onze samenleving; particulieren, bedrijven en overheden. We zijn op zoek naar een ervaren Projectmanager Ruimtelijke Ontwikkeling die zijn of haar steentje wil bijdragen aan de oplossing. Een adviseur die in staat is complexe ontwikkelingen te begeleiden en onze opdrachtgevers voorziet van ruimtelijk advies op maat.
Dit ga je doen
Werken als Projectmanager Ruimtelijke Ontwikkeling betekent deel uitmaken van een veelzijdig team dat met passie en ambitie werkt aan duurzame oplossingen binnen de fysieke leefomgeving. Dat doen wij vanaf het allereerste idee tot en met de uitvoering. Je gaat je bezighouden met uiteenlopende projecten, denk aan een omgevingsvisie, een beleidsmatige studie naar mogelijke woningbouwlocaties of een advies over de ontwikkeling van een bedrijventerrein, een circulair ambachtscentrum, de aanleg van een zonnepark of de realisatie van een nieuw recreatiegebied.
Op dagelijkse basis ben je als Projectmanager ruimtelijke ontwikkeling met de volgende taken bezig.
Je bent als projectmanager eindverantwoordelijk voor het financiële resultaat van je projecten, de samenwerking binnen het projectteam, de kwaliteit van de geleverde dienst en een tevreden klant.
Je coördineert integrale processen en multidisciplinaire projectteams (die je zelf samenstelt aan de hand van de opdrachtomschrijving) en verzorgt daarbij de financiële afwikkeling.
Je draagt bij aan de groei van onze opdrachtportefeuille door het opstellen van offertes en het begeleiden van aanbestedingsprocedures.
Je bent een vertrouwd partner voor onze opdrachtgevers, je onderhoudt de relaties en bouwt deze ook uit.
Je signaleert kansen en knelpunten in onze dienstverlening en onderneemt indien nodig actie om deze te benutten en verbeteren.
Je levert samen met andere teamleden actief een bijdrage aan het vormgeven van de strategie voor het team Ruimte.
Je begeleidt collega’s en helpt hen zichzelf verder te ontwikkelen.
Je maakt deel uit van het team dat zich bezig houdt met ons nieuwe concept Wijken van de Toekomst (https://www.stantec.com/nl/services/neighborhoods-of-the-future), waarin integrale oplossingen worden bedacht voor de grote uitdagingen van deze tijd;
Als je ambities hebt op andere thema’s dan is het in overleg altijd mogelijk om ook als Projectmanager een bijdrage te leveren aan onze dienstverlening uit onze andere werkvelden bouw, infra of milieu zijn.
Dit krijg je van ons:
Jouw doordachte oplossingen verdienen een mooie beloning. Die krijg je in de vorm van goede voorwaarden en een werkomgeving die minstens zo innovatief is als je ideeën. Je welzijn is daarbij onze prioriteit. Dit krijg je van ons:
Een passend salaris en goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een eindejaarsuitkering, NS Businesscard en 28 vakantiedagen.
Een afwisselende baan van 32, 36 of 40 uur per week, waarbij je echt impact kunt maken op de leefomgeving.
Een klimaat neutrale werkomgeving waar duurzaamheid voorop staat. Dat zie je o.a. terug in een elektrisch wagenpark, vegetarische catering en gave samenwerkingen met goede doelen.
Een divers team en een inclusieve cultuur. We voeren een actief diversiteitsbeleid om bij te dragen aan gelijke kansen. Talent en competenties vormen het uitgangspunt.
Veel ruimte voor jouw eigen ideeën en initiatieven. Kom maar door!
Je mag werken waar en op het tijdstip dat jij het beste uit jezelf kan halen, de ene dag in een bruisende kantoortuin waar collega’s uit alle lagen van de organisatie naast elkaar werken en de andere dag werk je vanuit huis en ga je lekker ’s middags sporten.
Een thuiswerkregeling, we verzorgen een goede werkplek bij je thuis en je ontvangt maandelijks een netto internetvergoeding á € 36,10 per maand.
Oneindig veel gezamenlijke activiteiten en leuke trainingen waardoor werk niet meer als werk voelt.

Title:
Projectmanager Ruimtelijke Ontwikkeling
Qualifications:
Dit kan je
Ben jij onze nieuwe Projectmanager Ruimtelijke Ontwikkeling? Dan kan/ben je dit:
Je hebt een hbo- of wo-diploma in de richting van in de richting Planologie, Stedenbouw, Gebiedseconomie of Sociale Geografie;
Je laat al minstens 5 jaar zien wat je kunt binnen het werkveld ruimtelijke ontwikkeling.
Je kent het woord stilzitten niet. Met jouw ondernemende instelling krijg je alles voor elkaar.
Je denkt in praktische oplossingen en bent erg resultaatgericht.
Je weet mensen te verrassen en inspireren met jouw creatieve, innovatieve ideeën.
Je hebt kennis van project- en procesmanagement, de Wet ruimtelijke ordening en de Omgevingswet;
Je bent communicatief ijzersterk, of het nu gaat om een overtuigende pitch of een helder rapport.
Employment Type: Full-Time
Job Type: Regular
Job Category: Consulting
About Stantec:
Als Stantec maken we de wereld beter. Dat doen we samen met 26.000 collega’s, werkend op 400 locaties, verdeeld over 6 continenten. Dit zijn stuk voor stuk mensgerichte adviseurs die geloven in een leefbare, veilige en duurzame omgeving. Met samenwerkingen, onderbouwd advies en een gezonde dosis lef maken we het verschil. In Nederland doen we dat met ruim 300 betrokken professionals onder het motto ‘design with community in mind’.
Bij Stantec werken we vanuit concrete vraagstukken naar praktische oplossingen. Hierbij gaan we altijd de dialoog aan met de betrokkenen, maken we slim gebruik van bestaande data en durven we keuzes te maken. Ook als die verrassend zijn. Resultaat zijn innovatieve, gedragen oplossingen waarmee we de wereld een stukje beter maken. Samen met jou.
Meer weten over de werksfeer binnen onze organisatie? We vertellen je hier graag alles over Stantec als werkgever: https://www.stantec.com/nl/careers.

Job Description
Fluor Consultants BV is focused on developing long term relationships with customers in revamping, debottlenecking and expanding the production capacity of their existing facilities in the Process Industry in the South West and South East of the Netherlands. Fluor provides the full project execution services: from conceptual engineering through commissioning and construction support.

The Electrical & Instrumentation & Control system group is a dynamic team in which engineering, design and leadership skills are combined to effectively support our clients. In addition to a solid education focusing on engineering and/or design, a strong set of personal competencies is a prerequisite for success. Being a team player and having an ability to interact effectively with client’s organization and others disciplines in our taskforce is essential.

In these projects, the lead engineer takes responsibility for the E&I&CS functionality for one or more projects in the oil, gas and (petro-) chemical industry. Leading 4-10 people and supported/coached by a senior engineer the lead engineer works within a task force for the realization of multi-discipline projects in close cooperation with other disciplines, vendors and clients to translate functional specifications into technical solutions.

For our office in Geleen we are looking for an experienced E&CS Lead Engineer.
To be Considered Candidates:
Must be authorized to work in the country where the position is located.
Basic Job Requirements
The successful candidate is responsible for and must be able to:
Perform engineering in several project phasesFeasibility studies, conceptual design and front-end designDetail engineering and design and plant commissioning for integration of new facilities in revamp typeDevelopment of P&ID’s, instrument index; instrument datasheets/specifications, instrument block diagramsControl of detailed design like:cable schedules/ panel layouts/ instrument layouts/ sketches/ loop and wiring diagrams/ hook-ups/ cable traysControl of electrical design and engineering; selection of materials; E&I&CS input to other disciplinesThe complete cycle of writing/reviewing instruments and control-systems specificationsSupplier selection, purchasing, supplier drawing review, Factory Acceptance TestsCoordinate field implementation including Site Acceptance Test, commissioning and turn-overInput to Basic Engineering Design Packages and Writing of contractor’s scope of workParticipate in HAZOP/ SIL/ LOPA sessionsSupervision, planning, organization of the workLead /coordinate the E&I&CS engineering/design team (4-10 people)Assign work in cooperation with the senior lead engineerPrepare schedules, estimates, manpower forecasts and apply change-risk managementCommunicate and align with clients, vendors and other disciplines
Other Job Requirements
10-15 years relevant working experience with an engineering
contractor or production company in the process industry.

Knowledge of field instrumentation technology
Knowledge of field wiring solutionsKnowledge of control system DCS and PLC hardware is a preferenceBasic knowledge of electrical systemsKnowledge of Functional safety (SIL), ATEX, is a preferenceExhibit understanding of pertinent codes and governing regulations and industry practicesExhibit understanding of the other discipline task and deliverables like electrical, process, piping, mechanical and civil/structural
Preferred Qualifications
Msc or Bsc education level or equivalentCandidates shall be fluent in both Dutch and English;
Written and verbal communication with our Client’s is as well in Dutch as in English

Strong interpersonal skills.Willingness to travelLeadership skills and able to multi-task

Leer het bouwproces in de praktijk kennen. Bij Dura Vermeer in Cruquius (tussen Haarlem en Hoofddorp) krijg jij als trainee Bouw & Vastgoed de kans om je breed te oriënteren of je direct al te specialiseren binnen diverse functies. Bijvoorbeeld als werkvoorbereider, BIM-modelleur, uitvoerder, tendermanager of projectontwikkelaar. Binnen twee jaar leer je ons bedrijf in de volle breedte kennen. Hier krijg jij de kans om mee te werken, denken én ontwikkelen aan innoverende opdrachten binnen de regio Noord-Holland en Utrecht.
Dit wordt jouw baan
Het tweejarige traineeship bij Dura Vermeer Bouw Midden West is een traineeship waar je de theorie die je hebt geleerd tijdens je hbo of wo studie Bouwkunde kan toepassen in de praktijk. Je voert meerdere functies uit in twee jaar tijd en gaat zowel binnen de kantoororganisatie als op de bouwplaats aan de slag. Functies die je kan gaan uitoefenen in het traineeship zijn: uitvoerder, werkvoorbereider (BIM engineer), BIM Modelleur, calculator, inkoper, medewerker bedrijfsbureau, projectontwikkelaar. Welke functie is helemaal aan jou! Heb je de wens om je breed te oriënteren binnen Dura Vermeer? Dan gaan we dat regelen. Liever direct specialiseren binnen een bepaalde functie? Dat kan ook. Jij bepaalt zelf hoe jouw traineeship eruit gaat zien en waar je wil gaan starten! Hoe gaaf is dat?
Samen met jouw coaches, mentoren en senior collega’s werk je aan jouw toekomst. Je leert ontzettend veel binnen een beperkte tijd. Naast dat jij operationele ervaring op gaat doen, neem je samen met de andere trainees van Bouw Midden West ook een organisatievraagstuk in behandeling. Zo leer je ook om een bepaald onderwerp op tactisch en strategisch niveau te bekijken. Natuurlijk wil jij bij de vernieuwers binnen de bouw horen. Dat vraagt om die ene extra stap tijdens het uitvoeren van een project. Die stap maak je graag, want jij hecht veel waarde aan het duurzamer, digitaler en innovatiever bouwen. Net als wij! Je bent van toegevoegde waarde binnen ons team en je durft een kritische houding aan te nemen en initiatief te pakken om resultaten te behalen. Ben jij klaar om te groeien binnen de bouw?
Wil je weten hoe onze trainees het traineeship ervaren? Lees dan de blog van onze trainees Rick en Danielle!
https://www.duravermeer.nl/nieuws/een-traineeship-bij-dura-vermeer-is-allesbehalve-in-beton-gegoten/
Ben je enthousiast geworden, maar heb je nog een aantal vragen? Trainee Robin Heide verteld jou graag meer over het traineeship. Je kunt haar bellen op het nummer 06-14760634. Of stuur haar een mailtje! (r.heide@duravermeer.nl)
Samen maken we het waar, elke dag opnieuw!
Meer bij Dura Vermeer
Dura Vermeer is een familiebedrijf. Een onafhankelijke bouwonderneming actief in woningbouw, utiliteitsbouw, infrastructuur en techniek in Nederland. Al sinds 1855 vormen onze onafhankelijkheid en langjarige continuïteit de basis voor onze strategie. Met een omzet van circa € 1,8 miljard en ruim 3.000 medewerkers
behoren we tot de top van de Nederlandse bouwsector. Samen realiseren we prachtige projecten. Iconische, en soms ook alledaagse projecten waarmee we
nieuwe antwoorden bieden op maatschappelijke vraagstukken. Waarmee we de beste oplossingen voor morgen garanderen en het verschil maken voor Nederland,
juist op de langere termijn. We hebben stevige ambities – en daarvoor geldt dat we die alleen kunnen waarmaken dankzij onze mensen. Als beste werkgever maken wij ons er daarom hard voor dat jij elke dag opnieuw kiest voor Dura Vermeer. Dat jij net zo trots bent op wat we maken als wij dat zijn. Dat iedereen die bij ons werkt gelukkig is. Dat je bij ons jezelf kunt zijn, je veilig voelt en je kunt uitspreken. En dat je tot je recht komt. En het beste uit jezelf kunt halen.
Hier zit je op je plek
Vanuit het Dura Vermeer-kantoor in Cruquius (vlakbij Haarlem en Hoofddorp) ga je aan de slag met verschillende woning- en utiliteitsbouwprojecten in de regio Noord-Holland en Utrecht. Dit doe je samen met gedreven collega’s uit verschillende disciplines. Wij werken veel samen met collega’s uit het bouwteam. Denk aan de projectleider, werkvoorbereider en projectmanager. Samen zorgen wij voor een stevige voorbereiding bij ieder project. Letterlijk van a tot z. We werken vanuit Building Information Modelling (BIM) en vanuit meerdere bouwstromen.
Bekijk deze werkmaatschappij
Waar jij gaat werken

Minimaal een afgeronde hbo- of wo opleiding Bouwkunde (of soortgelijke studierichting).
Een commerciële en leergierige instelling.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je woont in de omgeving van Amsterdam, Haarlem of Utrecht.
Je bent fulltime beschikbaar.
Dit bieden wij jou
Een goed salaris dat meegroeit met jouw ontwikkeling.30 verlofdagen met de mogelijkheid om er maximaal 13 bij te kopen of uit te laten betalen.Uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals een standaardverzekering van alle werknemersrisico’s, pensioenregelingen, een extra aanvulling bij
arbeidsongeschiktheid en een bijdrage voor het vakbondslidmaatschap.Een laptop en smartphone.Een mobiliteitsbudget, NS Business Card, reiskostenvergoeding of (elektrische) leaseauto.Veel aandacht voor jouw groei dankzij onze eigen Dura Vermeer Academie met volop opleiding- en trainingsmogelijkheden binnen je vakgebied, maar
bijvoorbeeld ook op het gebied van vitaliteit.Bedrijfsfitnessregeling met keuze uit een sportaanbod van ruim 3.500 sportlocaties door heel Nederland.Een goede werk-privébalans dankzij een flexibel werken beleid en soepele regelingen voor arbeidsduur, werktijden, calamiteiten, mantelzorg of
sabbatical.Een vast bedrag Budget Duurzame Inzetbaarheid bovenop je brutosalaris (conform CAO Bouw & Infra).Voor verse vaders en partners: 100% doorbetaling van je salaris tijdens de eerste 5 wettelijke verlofdagen én het 5 weken aanvullend ouderschapsverlof,
in plaats van de standaard 70%.
Wil jij ook meer uit je werk halen?
Dan zijn wij nieuwsgierig naar jou! Solliciteren kan direct via onze website middels de solliciteerbutton onder de vacature.
Heb jij hart voor de bouw?
Dan zijn wij nieuwsgierig naar jou! Stuur ons je sollicitatie en wij gaan voor je aan de slag. In onderstaand stappenplan lees je wat je daarna van ons kunt verwachten. Heb je nog vragen? Stel ze aan onze recruiter via onderstaande contactgegevens.

Are you an independent, creative mind who wants to positively impact how the world develops and operates its infrastructure? And are you interested in a seat at the table for infrastructure investment decisions? Do you aspire to make sustainable ambitions happen?
 Arup is the creative force at the heart of many of the world’s most prominent projects in the built environment, transport and energy sectors. Independently owned and independently minded, we offer a broad range of professional services that combine to make a real difference to our clients and the communities in which we work. For more than 75 years, we have helped bring to life ground-breaking projects across the globe. We are truly global, and our 17,000 planners, designers, engineers and consultants around the world deliver innovative projects with creativity and passion.

 We are a global market leader in infrastructure and energy technical and ESG advisory for investors, evidenced by the many awards we have won in this space. Infrastructure Journal, the leading infrastructure investment outlet, has awarded Arup the Global Technical Advisor award four years in a row now, plus we have been awarded the Infrastructure Journal Global ESG Advisor award the last two years running.


Senior Consultant Investor Advisory

Our global award winning and market leading business and investor advisory (BIA) team provides technical, commercial and sustainable advisory for investors and project developers in the energy transition. We do so at strategic level – where and in what to invest –, in live transactions – sell-side and buy-side due diligence, and at portfolio level – how can investors convert existing portfolios towards the needs of the energy transition.
The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering projects to private sector investor clients and public sector bodies. Projects may range from due diligence to market assessments, corporate strategy, business cases and feasibility studies and sustainable investment advisory. Project work will require a range of quantitative and qualitative analysis skills including:

Undertaking economic and financial analysis, demand and revenue forecasting, market assessments, asset evaluations, and providing commercial advice
Developing Excel-based commercial and financial models to support project analysis and advice.
Liaising with experts within and outside the organisation on complex issues
Preparing and supporting delivery of reports and presentations to clients.

Developing and maintaining client relationships, and supporting business development, project proposals and project delivery;Our projects generally last between 4-10 weeks meaning in a year you can work on up to 8-10 different projects across a variety of assets and geographies, giving you exposure to several different assets and clients. Our projects are fast-paced and provide you with opportunities to develop quickly whilst gaining a range of experience.
Currently we are rapidly growing our recently established BIA team in Amsterdam that focusses on the EU and predominantly Benelux and wider northwestern Europe.

Your background
You should have a technical understanding and interest in any or, preferably more, of the following energy transition assets:
Renewable energy (e.g. solar, wind)Hydrogen value chainBattery manufacturing and/or storageBiogas, biomethaneLow emission mobility like EV charging, biofuels, sustainable aviation fuels, sustainable maritime fuels

You will also be able to demonstrate some general commercial, economic and/or regulatory understanding in these sectors. Previous experience in working with infrastructure investors is a plus.

Your responsibilities

Act as technical, commercial and sustainability “conscience” for infrastructure investors through the production of due diligence reports, business plans, strategic insights and portfolio optimisation studies
Take the central, client facing role and act as Arup Project Manager in international advisory projects
Manage multi-disciplinary project delivery teams, liaising with other experts within and outside the organisation on complex issues
Collaborate with wider international teams to develop our hydrogen and sustainable investment offering
Prepare and attend meetings with clients to present findings on projects and on a business-development basis to discuss new opportunities andmanaging relationships with existing and new clients
Likely to involve short business travel (mainly Europe).

Your profile

You can identify yourself with our values and you want to collaborate with us in shaping a better world with iconic and innovative projects. To maintain Arup’s high-quality standards, we would expect you to meet the following minimum criteria:

A Bachelor/ Master’s degree in commercial, economic, or financial analysis, and/or relevant working experience in a related role
Core skills in commercial and market analysis, problem solving, and an ability to adapt and apply these to a range of projects.
Excellent communication skills (written and spoken Dutch & English at least B2 level) and ability to distil complex analysis into key messages and develop these into a coherent narrative. You will also have responsibility to present findings and discuss these with clients.
Adaptability and flexibility to work on projects with relatively short deadlines, with changing scope and focus as information and analysis evolves.
Strong knowledge of both Excel and PowerPoint as tools to undertake and present analysis.
Desire and capability to engage in business development and client relationship building.
Keenness for emerging, sustainable infrastructure and industrial sectors
Affinity translating technical solutions into bankable and sustainable projects
Highly motivated, proactive and willing to take on new challenges

About working at Arup
At Arup, you will work alongside some of the most talented people, who share your ambition to make a difference while being part of an employee-owned company putting sustainable development at the heart of our work and strategy. You’ll get to work on projects that push people’s expectations of what’s possible, from inspiring buildings to projects that will shape our future and help us mitigate the impact of climate change. We offer you a job in a multicultural and informal international working environment with excellent colleagues. Arup is a place where creativity, innovation and exciting technical challenges are always possible; we are part of a team that enjoys what they do, embracing a unique culture. As a global firm we can develop careers in the Netherlands or abroad through international assignments, and our commitment to training and development is fundamental to ensure we continue to develop our staff and look to the future requirements of our clients.

We offer you an Arup contract with a competitive salary and good fringe benefits such as an excellent pension and travel expenses, OV chipcard 1st class, even travelling by bike is covered.
At Arup, you work in an international environment that enables you to share knowledge and experience with the whole world. In addition, there are short- and long-term opportunities to work in one of our offices abroad
Arup is an independent, employee-owned company. Employees at Arup are shareholders of the organisation and are eligible for the Global Profit Share programme. This means that as an employee you will receive a profit share twice a year.
A relatively large part of our capital is reinvested in training and research. These budgets are available to all employees.
We have our own Arup University with internal and external training courses to keep you constantly developing.
Arup arranges all facilities so you can work ergonomically and responsibly from home.

Find out more
For more information about the hiring process, contact Evelien Wind, recruitment business partner at Arup in The Netherlands by e-mail: recruitmentnl@arup.com. Or contact Maarten Wessels, Associate by e-mail: Maarten.Wessels@arup.com for more substantive information on this role.

How to apply
Got excited and want to apply? Please use the ‘apply’ button to upload your cv and letter of motivation (English only) into the Arup application portal on our website www.arup.com/careers.

The application process will focus predominantly on good conversations about our sectors, experiences, insights, ambitions and ideas. On how you can help drive infrastructure to become more resilient and sustainable, but also how Arup can help you progress you career.

Sir Ove Arup (1895-1988), the founder of our company, was known as 'the philosopher engineer'. He did not settle for conventions, came up with inventive solutions and his mission was always to design a more beautiful and sustainable world. He argued that this goal could best be achieved by putting the quality of the work first through the application of "Total Architecture". His vision worked, and Arup has since grown into a leading global engineering, design and consultancy firm.
If this philosophy appeals to you, then we are looking for you!
Mechanical Engineer
(Sustainable Industry)
About the Role
Arup is an independent firm of designers, planners, engineers, consultants and technical specialists offering a broad range of professional services worldwide. Through our work, we make a positive difference and help shape a better world.
We currently have a requirement for a Mechanical Engineer to join our growing Sustainable Industry team based in our Amsterdam office. The ideal candidate will be looking to further their career and gain invaluable experience in Building Services within an established consultancy with a friendly office environment. This is a permanent role and offers the successful candidate long-term opportunities for career development. The successful candidate will be involved in a diverse and challenging range of design projects including data centres, laboratories, and advanced manufacturing facilities.
Minimum Qualifications:
Degree in Building Services Engineering or Mechanical Engineering2+ years post-qualification experience, most of which will be in design gained within a consultancy environmentTeam playerOrganised and adaptable with a flexible approach to workAbility to meet strict deadlinesExcellent communication and report writing skills, preferred DutchDeveloping knowledge of relevant standards and regulationsExperience in the design of the main Building Services Mechanical systems such as HVAC, public health, etc.
Key Differentiators:
Experience in science, industry and technology (SIT) projectsKnowledge of Dutch codes, standards and permitting requirementsRevit experience
Responsibilities:
Project planningConceptual design studies and reportsDetailed design of Mechanical Services and InstallationsCompilation of Specifications for Mechanical Services and InstallationsEnsuring full co-ordination between specifications, drawings and BIM modelsClient presentations and engagementLiaising with architects, clients and other stakeholders to set the constraints of the mechanical design and co-ordinate with all other disciplines in terms of the mechanical requirements and the mechanical discipline’s influence on all others.
About working at Arup
At Arup, you will work alongside some of the most talented people, who share your ambition to make a difference while being part of an employee-owned company putting sustainable development at the heart of our work and strategy. You’ll get to work on projects that push people’s expectations of what’s possible, from inspiring buildings to projects that will shape our future and help us mitigate the impact of climate change.
We offer you an Arup contract with a competitive salary and good fringe benefits such as an excellent pension and travel expenses, OV chipcard 1st class, even travelling by bike is covered.
At Arup, you work in an international environment that enables you to share knowledge and experience with the whole world. In addition, there are short- and long-term opportunities to work in one of our offices abroad
Arup is an independent, employee-owned company. Employees at Arup are shareholders of the organisation and are eligible for the Global Profit Share programme. This means that as an employee you will receive a profit share twice a year.
A relatively large part of our capital is reinvested in training and research. These budgets are available to all employees.
We have our own Arup University with internal and external training courses to keep you constantly developing.
Arup arranges all facilities so you can work ergonomically and responsibly from home.
And last but not least, the opportunity to create impact in our society with the next level regenerative buildings.

Find out more
For more information about this vacancy please contact Evelien Wind, recruitment business partner at Arup in The Netherlands by e-mail: recruitmentnl@arup.com. Or Ryan Wilson by e-mail: Ryan.Wilson@arup.com.

Job Description
Scope of Activities
Fluor Consultants BV is focusing on developing long term relationships with customers in revamping, debottlenecking, and expanding the production capacity of their existing facilities in the process Industry in the South West of the Netherlands. The Bergen op Zoom, and Rotterdam offices provide the full project execution services: from conceptual engineering through commissioning and construction support. Together with Stork (a Fluor company) we have the unique market capacity to offer integrated solutions to our clients. This includes fabrication, modularization, and maintenance.

The Electrical & Instrumentation & Control system group is a dynamic team in which engineering, design and leadership skills are combined to effectively support our clients. In addition to a solid education focusing on engineering and/or design, a strong set of personal competencies is a prerequisite for success. Being a team player and having an ability to interact effectively with client’s organization and others disciplines in our taskforce is essential.

In these projects, engineers / designers take responsibility for the functionality of the electrical & Instrumentation & Control system project scope in the oil, gas and (petro-) chemical industry, renewable energy solutions, life science and advanced manufacturing. They work within a task force for the realization of multi-discipline projects in close cooperation with vendors and clients to translate functional specifications into technical solutions.

Key Responsibilities
The successful candidate is responsible for and must be able to:
Perform engineering in several, but not yet all, project phases e.g. Feasibility studies, conceptual design, front-end design, detail engineering and design and plant commissioning for integration of new facilities in revamp type project as well for ‘small’ grass-root type of projects. Work activities include e.g.:
o Development of P&ID’s, instrument index; instrument datasheets/specifications, instrument block diagrams; control of detailed design like cable schedules/ panel layouts/ instrument layouts/ sketches/ loop and wiring diagrams/ hook-ups/ cable trays; control of electrical design and engineering; selection of materials; E&I&CS input to other disciplines.
o The complete cycle of writing/reviewing instruments and control-systems specifications in accordance with client requirements and authority regulations, supplier selection, purchasing, supplier drawing review, Factory Acceptance Tests, coordinate field implementation including Site Acceptance Test, commissioning and turn-over.

o Input to Basic Engineering Design Packages and Writing of contractors’ scope of work

o Participate in HAZOP/ SIL/ LOPA sessions
o Assure integrity of the developed design documents. Assure it works and is safe and according specification
Supervision, planning, organization of the work:
o Coordinate the I&CS engineering/design team (2-4 people); Assign work in cooperation with the senior lead engineer.
o Communicate and align with clients, vendors and other disciplines.


Proven Experience
5-15 years relevant working experience with an engineering
contractor or production company in the process industry.

Knowledge of field instrumentation technology
Performing instrument calculations
Knowledge of field wiring solutionsKnowledge of control system DCS and PLC hardware is a preferenceBasic knowledge of electrical systemsKnowledge of Functional safety (SIL), ATEX, is a preferenceExhibit understanding of pertinent codes and governing regulations and industry practicesExhibit understanding of the other discipline task and deliverables like electrical, process, piping, mechanical and civil/structural

Lead the Mechanical Services design on SIT projects while working closely with the other discipline leadsWork with and manage junior mechanical engineers and BIM modellers on your projectsProject planningConceptual design studies and reportsDetailed design of Mechanical Services and InstallationsCompilation of Specifications for Mechanical Services and InstallationsEnsuring full co-ordination between specifications, drawings and BIM modelsClient presentations and engagementLiaising with architects, clients and other stakeholders to set the constraints of the mechanical design and co-ordinate with all other disciplines in terms of the mechanical requirements and the mechanical discipline’s influence on all others.
About working at Arup
At Arup, you will work alongside some of the most talented people, who share your ambition to make a difference while being part of an employee-owned company putting sustainable development at the heart of our work and strategy. You’ll get to work on projects that push people’s expectations of what’s possible, from inspiring buildings to projects that will shape our future and help us mitigate the impact of climate change.
We offer you an Arup contract with a competitive salary and good fringe benefits such as an excellent pension and travel expenses, OV chipcard 1st class, even travelling by bike is covered.
At Arup, you work in an international environment that enables you to share knowledge and experience with the whole world. In addition, there are short- and long-term opportunities to work in one of our offices abroad
Arup is an independent, employee-owned company. Employees at Arup are shareholders of the organisation and are eligible for the Global Profit Share programme. This means that as an employee you will receive a profit share twice a year.
A relatively large part of our capital is reinvested in training and research. These budgets are available to all employees.
We have our own Arup University with internal and external training courses to keep you constantly developing.
Arup arranges all facilities so you can work ergonomically and responsibly from home.
And last but not least, the opportunity to create impact in our society with the next level regenerative buildings.

Job Description
Fluor Consultants BV is focusing on developing long term relationships with customers in revamping, debottlenecking, and expanding the production capacity of their existing facilities in the process Industry in the South West of the Netherlands. The Bergen op Zoom and Rotterdam offices provide the full project execution services: from conceptual engineering through commissioning and construction support. Together with Stork (a Fluor company) we have the unique market capacity to offer integrated solutions to our clients. This includes fabrication, modularization and maintenance.

The Electrical & Instrumentation & Control system group is a dynamic team in which engineering, design and leadership skills are combined to effectively support our clients. In addition to a solid education focusing on engineering and/or design, a strong set of personal competencies is a prerequisite for success. Being a team player and having an ability to interact effectively with client’s organization and others disciplines in our taskforce is essential.

In these projects, engineers / designers take responsibility for the functionality of the electrical & Instrumentation & Control system project scope in the oil, gas and (petro-) chemical industry, renewable energy solutions, life science and advanced manufacturing. They work within a task force for the realization of multi-discipline projects in close cooperation with vendors and clients to translate functional specifications into technical solutions.
Key Responsibilities
The successful candidate is responsible for and must be able to:
Perform engineering in all project phases e.g. Feasibility studies, conceptual design, front-end design, detail engineering and design and plant commissioning for integration of new facilities in revamp type project as well for ‘small’ grass-root type of projects for installations in all voltage levels HV, MV, LV. Work activities include e.g.:Development of the engineering and design details to properly size, calculate, design and description of the installation details for a complete and operating electrical system that meets the Client requirements for E.g.: Feeder panels, MCC’s, Substations, Transformers, Motors, Power Cables, Lightning systems, Grounding systems; a contractor’s scope of work and oversee the development of detailed design drawings like one-line diagrams, plans, wiring details and fabrication drawings.
The complete cycle of writing/reviewing control-systems specifications in accordance with client requirements and authority regulations, supplier selection, purchasing, supplier drawing review, Factory Acceptance Tests, coordinate field implementation including Site Acceptance Test, commissioning and turn-over. This for all system hardware required.Supervision, planning, organization of the work:Coordinate the electrical engineering and design. Assign work in cooperation with the department manager / engineering managerPrepare schedules, estimates, manpower forecasts and apply change-risk management.Communicate and align with clients, vendors and other disciplines.
Supervise and act as mentor for a group of junior and intermediate level engineers/designers
Promote and support Value improvements initiatives and Continuous Performance Improvement
To be Considered Candidates:
Must be authorized to work in the country where the position is located.
Basic Job Requirements
Minimum 15 years relevant working experience with an engineering contractor or production company in the process industry.Exhibit thorough understanding of pertinent codes and governing regulations and industry practicesExhibit thorough understanding and having practical knowledge/experience with field installations, field verifications and available electrical componentsKnowledge of electrical calculation programs like VISION, ETAP is preferred.
Other Job Requirements
Bachelor, Master degree or equivalent in electrical power systems / high voltage engineeringCandidates shall be fluent in both Dutch and English
Written and verbal communication with our Client’s is as well in Dutch as in English

Strong interpersonal skillsWillingness to travelBe able to multi-task between multiple projects
